mainmenu

Class Pong3

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • mainmenu.Pong3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Pong3
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    This class represents the pong game logic with all the animations. After the selections are made in the main menu, this class launches the actual pong game where users can compete.
    Author:
    Maksym Kolov, Neil Patel, Austin Mclemore

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pong3()
      This method controls the pong game by setting position of all game elements as well as defining the controls for it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void ballMove()
      This method controls the ball movement within the screen.
      void bar1Move()
      This method controls the movement of two of the hard mode barriers on the screen.
      void bar2Move()
      This method controls the movement of the third hard mode barrier on the screen.
      void barrierCollision(javafx.geometry.Bounds ballObject)
      This method initializes the bounds of the hard mode barriers.
      void begin()
      This method starts the game and randomizes the initial ball movement.
      void collisionDetection()
      This method controls the collision logic and ball movements when it hits either one of the paddles or the screen edges.
      void hardMode()
      This method adds the hard mode elements on the screen as well as animating them.
      void instButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
      This method instantiates the button to go back to the main menu.
      private void makeBarriers()
      This method makes the barriers for the hard mode game.
      private void movePaddlesBy(int y1, int y2)
      This method controls the step of the paddle movement
      private void movePaddlesTo(double m1, double m2)
      This method controls the boundaries of the moving paddles.
      void resetBoard()
      This method resets the game allowing to play one more point round.
      void restartPane()
      This method displays the pane after the game is over allowing players to either play again or go back to the main menu.
